src.io.dataloader module¶

This module contains the Dataset-adapters for all relevant datasets


class src.io.dataloader.DSetPhoc(alphabet=[<Alphabet.ASCII_LOWER: 1>, <Alphabet.ASCII_DIGITS: 4>, <Alphabet.ASCII_PUNCTUATION: 3>], phoc_levels=3, augment_imgs=True, lower_case=True, scale=(None, None))[source]¶

Bases: torch.utils.data.dataset.Dataset

Base-class for a dataset-adapter dealing with PHOC encodings, comes with a set of words and display method. Subclasses do not need to write the __getitem__ method if self.table is a DataFrame with the following collumns:

  • bbox: x0,y0,x1,y1 -> bounding box of image

  • form_path: path to page / image of origin

  • transcription: the word-imgs transcription

  • word_id: an unique id for the word (usefull for debugging)


The __getitem__ method then returns a dictionary:

  • bbox: bbox of word in form

  • img: word_img (e.g. augmented, if augment_imgs is True)

  • non_aug_img: none-augmented image (optional, if augment_imgs is True)

  • transcription: transcription of the image

  • phoc: PHOC-encoding of the transcription

  • word_id: an unique id for the word (usefull for debugging)

class src.io.dataloader.DSetQuant[source]¶

Bases: enum.Enum

Enumeration of different quantification approaches, regarding the augmentation of a dataset.

EQUAL = 2¶
RANDOM = 1¶
RESPECTIVE = 3¶
class src.io.dataloader.GWDataSet(sep=' ', lazy_loading=False, phoc_levels=3, lower_case=True, alphabet=[<Alphabet.ASCII_LOWER: 1>, <Alphabet.ASCII_DIGITS: 4>, <Alphabet.ASCII_PUNCTUATION: 3>], scale=(None, None), csvs_path='/data/mspringe/gwdb/almazan/queries/queries.gtp', imgs_path='/data/mspringe/gwdb/almazan/images/')[source]¶

Bases: src.io.dataloader.DSetPhoc

pytorch Dataset adapter of the George Washingtion dataset

Note

We are using the almazan 4 fold cross validation for the George Washington dataset. The queries and splits can be obtained from the links in this repository.

fold(k)[source]¶

generates the k-ths fold of the Almazan 4-fold cross validation

class src.io.dataloader.HWSynthDataSet(phoc_levels=3, alphabet=[<Alphabet.ASCII_LOWER: 1>, <Alphabet.ASCII_DIGITS: 4>, <Alphabet.ASCII_PUNCTUATION: 3>], augment=False, scale=(None, None), lower_case=True, csvs_path='/data/mspringe/hw_synth/groundtruth/', imgs_path='/vol/corpora/document-image-analysis/hw-synth/Images_90K_Normalized/')[source]¶

Bases: src.io.dataloader.DSetPhoc

pytorch Dataset adapter of the IIIT-HWSynth dataset

Note

  • csvs_path can lead to the directory where the annotations are stored or directly to the annotations

  • imgs_path leads to the directory where the images are stored

When training on IIIT-HWSynth I would suggest to pass the following arguments:

python3 src/training/phocnet_trainer.py \
path/to/dir_out \
hws \
path/to/hws/annotations \
path/to/hws/Images_90K_Normalized \
--max_iter=1e5 \
--model_name=pretrained_PHOCNet \
--gpu_idx=cuda:0 \
--k_fold=1 \
--alphabet=ldp \
--s_batch=32 \
--augment=none \
--shuffle=false

class src.io.dataloader.RimesDataSet(sep=' ', lazy_loading=True, phoc_levels=3, augment=False, lower_case=True, scale=(None, None), alphabet=[<Alphabet.ASCII_LOWER: 1>, <Alphabet.ASCII_DIGITS: 4>, <Alphabet.ASCII_PUNCTUATION: 3>], csvs_path='/data/mspringe/rimes/gt/', imgs_path='/data/mspringe/rimes/imgs/')[source]¶

Bases: src.io.dataloader.DSetPhoc

pytorch Dataset adapter of the RIMES dataset

Note

  • csvs_path should lead to the directory where test and training annotations are stored

  • imgs_path should lead to the directory where all images are stored
